meanings.sent1: She placed the toy car in the mids of the room.
meanings.sent2: The cake was delicious, especially the mids with the creamy filling.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to nap right in the mids of the busy sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed through the mids of the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The sun shone brightly on the mids of the garden, highlighting the colorful flowers.

meanings.definition: The middle of a time period.
meanings.sent1: In the mids of the day, the sun was at its peak.
meanings.sent2: During the mids of summer, the days are long and hot.
meanings.sent3: The clock struck twelve right in the mids of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her birthday falls in the mids of December, close to Christmas.
meanings.sent5: The festival takes place in the mids of spring, celebrating the blooming flowers.

meanings.sent1: They reached the mids of their road trip when they stopped for lunch.
meanings.sent2: The hikers rested at the mids of the mountain trail to enjoy the view.
meanings.sent3: The ship encountered a storm in the mids of the ocean voyage.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runners pushed through the mids of the race, determined to finish.
meanings.sent5: The explorers found a hidden cave in the mids of their expedition, filled with ancient artifacts.
